00022 #ifndef _XENO_NUCLEUS_THREAD_H
00023 #define _XENO_NUCLEUS_THREAD_H

00031 /* State flags */
00032 
00033 #define XNSUSP    0x00000001 
00034 #define XNPEND    0x00000002 
00035 #define XNDELAY   0x00000004 
00036 #define XNREADY   0x00000008 
00037 #define XNDORMANT 0x00000010 
00038 #define XNZOMBIE  0x00000020 
00039 #define XNRESTART 0x00000040 
00040 #define XNSTARTED 0x00000080 
00041 #define XNMAPPED  0x00000100 
00042 #define XNRELAX   0x00000200 
00043 #define XNMIGRATE 0x00000400 
00045 #define XNBOOST   0x00000800 
00046 #define XNDEBUG   0x00001000 
00047 #define XNLOCK    0x00002000 
00048 #define XNRRB     0x00004000 
00049 #define XNASDI    0x00008000 
00051 /*
00052  * Some skins may depend on the following fields to live in the high
00053  * 16-bit word, in order to be combined with the emulated RTOS flags
00054  * which use the low one, so don't change them carelessly.
00055  */
00056 #define XNTRAPSW  0x00010000 
00057 #define XNRPIOFF  0x00020000 
00058 #define XNFPU     0x00100000 
00059 #define XNSHADOW  0x00200000 
00060 #define XNROOT    0x00400000  /* Ends doxygen comment group: nucleus_state_flags */
00063 
00064 /*
00065   Must follow the declaration order of the above bits. Status symbols
00066   are defined as follows:
00067   'S' -> Forcibly suspended.
00068   'w'/'W' -> Waiting for a resource, with or without timeout.
00069   'D' -> Delayed (without any other wait condition).
00070   'R' -> Runnable.
00071   'U' -> Unstarted or dormant.
00072   'X' -> Relaxed shadow.
00073   'b' -> Priority boost undergoing.
00074   'T' -> Ptraced and stopped.
00075   'l' -> Locks scheduler.
00076   'r' -> Undergoes round-robin.
00077   's' -> Interrupt shield enabled.
00078   't' -> Mode switches trapped.
00079   'o' -> Priority coupling off.
00080   'f' -> FPU enabled (for kernel threads).
00081 */
00082 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_LABELS  "SWDRU....X.bTlr.to..f.."
00083 
00084 #define XNTHREAD_BLOCK_BITS   (XNSUSP|XNPEND|XNDELAY|XNDORMANT|XNRELAX|XNMIGRATE)
00085 #define XNTHREAD_MODE_BITS    (XNLOCK|XNRRB|XNASDI|XNTRAPSW|XNRPIOFF)
00086 
00087 /* These state flags are available to the real-time interfaces */
00088 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE0  0x10000000
00089 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE1  0x20000000
00090 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE2  0x40000000
00091 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARE3  0x80000000
00092 #define XNTHREAD_STATE_SPARES  0xf0000000
00093 
00100 /* Information flags */
00101 
00102 #define XNTIMEO   0x00000001 
00103 #define XNRMID    0x00000002 
00104 #define XNBREAK   0x00000004 
00105 #define XNKICKED  0x00000008 
00106 #define XNWAKEN   0x00000010 
00107 #define XNROBBED  0x00000020 
00108 #define XNATOMIC  0x00000040 
00109 #define XNAFFSET  0x00000080 
00110 #define XNPRIOSET 0x00000100 
00112 /* These information flags are available to the real-time interfaces */
00113 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE0  0x10000000
00114 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE1  0x20000000
00115 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE2  0x40000000
00116 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARE3  0x80000000
00117 #define XNTHREAD_INFO_SPARES  0xf0000000
00118  /* Ends doxygen comment group: nucleus_info_flags */

00166 typedef struct xnthread {
00167 
00168         xnarchtcb_t tcb;                /* Architecture-dependent block -- Must be first */
00169 
00170         xnflags_t state;                /* Thread state flags */
00171 
00172         xnflags_t info;                 /* Thread information flags */
00173 
00174         struct xnsched *sched;          /* Thread scheduler */

00176         struct xnsched_class *sched_class; /* Current scheduling class */
00177 
00178         struct xnsched_class *base_class; /* Base scheduling class */
00179 
00180 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_SCHED_TP
00181         struct xnsched_tpslot *tps;     /* Current partition slot for TP scheduling */
00182 
00183         struct xnholder tp_link;        /* Link in per-sched TP thread queue */
00184 #endif
00185 
00186         xnarch_cpumask_t affinity;      /* Processor affinity. */
00187 
00188         int bprio;                      /* Base priority (before PIP boost) */
00189

00191 
00192         u_long schedlck;                
00194         xnpholder_t rlink;              /* Thread holder in ready queue */
00195 
00196         xnpholder_t plink;              /* Thread holder in synchronization queue(s) */
00197 
00198 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PRIOCPL
00199         xnpholder_t xlink;              /* Thread holder in the RPI queue (shadow only) */
00200 
00201         struct xnsched *rpi;            /* Backlink pointer to the RPI slot (shadow only) */
00202 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PRIOCPL */
00203 
00204         xnholder_t glink;               /* Thread holder in global queue */
00205 
00206 #define link2thread(ln, fld)    container_of(ln, xnthread_t, fld)
00207 
00208         xnpqueue_t claimq;              /* Owned resources claimed by others (PIP) */
00209 
00210         struct xnsynch *wchan;          /* Resource the thread pends on */
00211 
00212         struct xnsynch *wwake;          /* Wait channel the thread was resumed from */
00213         
00214         xntimer_t rtimer;               /* Resource timer */
00215 
00216         xntimer_t ptimer;               /* Periodic timer */
00217         
00218         xnsigmask_t signals;            /* Pending core signals */
00219 
00220         xnticks_t rrperiod;             /* Allotted round-robin period (ticks) */
00221 
00222         xnticks_t rrcredit;             /* Remaining round-robin time credit (ticks) */
00223 
00224         union {
00225                 struct {
00226                         void *ptr;
00227                         size_t size;
00228                 } buffer;
00229         } wait_u;
00230 
00231         struct {
00232                 xnstat_counter_t ssw;   /* Primary -> secondary mode switch count */
00233                 xnstat_counter_t csw;   /* Context switches (includes secondary -> primary switches) */
00234                 xnstat_counter_t pf;    /* Number of page faults */
00235                 xnstat_exectime_t account; /* Execution time accounting entity */
00236                 xnstat_exectime_t lastperiod; /* Interval marker for execution time reports */
00237         } stat;
00238 
00239         int errcode;                    /* Local errno */
00240 
00241         xnasr_t asr;                    /* Asynchronous service routine */
00242 
00243         xnflags_t asrmode;              /* Thread's mode for ASR */
00244 
00245         int asrimask;                   /* Thread's interrupt mask for ASR */
00246 
00247         unsigned asrlevel;              /* ASR execution level (ASRs are reentrant) */
00248 
00249         int imask;                      /* Initial interrupt mask */
00250 
00251         int imode;                      /* Initial mode */
00252 
00253         struct xnsched_class *init_class; /* Initial scheduling class */
00254 
00255         union xnsched_policy_param init_schedparam; /* Initial scheduling parameters */
00256 
00257 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY
00258         struct {
00259                 xnhandle_t handle;      /* Handle in registry */
00260                 const char *waitkey;    /* Pended key */
00261         } registry;
00262 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY */
00263 
00264         xnthrops_t *ops;                /* Thread class operations. */
00265 
00266         char name[XNOBJECT_NAME_LEN]; /* Symbolic name of thread */
00267 
00268         void (*entry)(void *cookie); /* Thread entry routine */
00269 
00270         void *cookie;           /* Cookie to pass to the entry routine */
00271 
00272 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE
00273         unsigned long __user *u_mode;   /* Thread mode variable in userland. */
00274 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_PERVASIVE */

00276     XNARCH_DECL_DISPLAY_CONTEXT();

00278 } xnthread_t;

00290 #define xnthread_name(thread)               ((thread)->name)
00291 #define xnthread_clear_name(thread)        do { *(thread)->name = 0; } while(0)
00292 #define xnthread_sched(thread)             ((thread)->sched)
00293 #define xnthread_start_time(thread)        ((thread)->stime)
00294 #define xnthread_state_flags(thread)       ((thread)->state)
00295 #define xnthread_test_state(thread,flags)  testbits((thread)->state,flags)
00296 #define xnthread_set_state(thread,flags)   __setbits((thread)->state,flags)
00297 #define xnthread_clear_state(thread,flags) __clrbits((thread)->state,flags)
00298 #define xnthread_test_info(thread,flags)   testbits((thread)->info,flags)
00299 #define xnthread_set_info(thread,flags)    __setbits((thread)->info,flags)
00300 #define xnthread_clear_info(thread,flags)  __clrbits((thread)->info,flags)
00301 #define xnthread_lock_count(thread)        ((thread)->schedlck)
00302 #define xnthread_init_schedparam(thread)   ((thread)->init_schedparam)
00303 #define xnthread_base_priority(thread)     ((thread)->bprio)
00304 #define xnthread_current_priority(thread)  ((thread)->cprio)
00305 #define xnthread_time_slice(thread)        ((thread)->rrperiod)
00306 #define xnthread_time_credit(thread)       ((thread)->rrcredit)
00307 #define xnthread_archtcb(thread)           (&((thread)->tcb))
00308 #define xnthread_asr_level(thread)         ((thread)->asrlevel)
00309 #define xnthread_pending_signals(thread)  ((thread)->signals)
00310 #define xnthread_timeout(thread)           xntimer_get_timeout(&(thread)->rtimer)
00311 #define xnthread_stack_size(thread)        xnarch_stack_size(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00312 #define xnthread_stack_base(thread)        xnarch_stack_base(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00313 #define xnthread_stack_end(thread)         xnarch_stack_end(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00314 #define xnthread_handle(thread)            ((thread)->registry.handle)
00315 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC
00316 #define xnthread_time_base(thread)         ((thread)->rtimer.base)
00317 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC */
00318 #define xnthread_time_base(thread)         (&nktbase)
00319 #endif /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_TIMING_PERIODIC */
00320 #define xnthread_signaled_p(thread)        ((thread)->signals != 0)
00321 #define xnthread_timed_p(thread)              (!!testbits(xnthread_time_base(thread)->status, XNTBRUN))
00322 #define xnthread_user_task(thread)         xnarch_user_task(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00323 #define xnthread_user_pid(thread) \
00324     (xnthread_test_state((thread),XNROOT) || !xnthread_user_task(thread) ? \
00325     0 : xnarch_user_pid(xnthread_archtcb(thread)))
00326 #define xnthread_affinity(thread)          ((thread)->affinity)
00327 #define xnthread_affine_p(thread, cpu)     xnarch_cpu_isset(cpu, (thread)->affinity)
00328 #define xnthread_get_exectime(thread)      xnstat_exectime_get_total(&(thread)->stat.account)
00329 #define xnthread_get_lastswitch(thread)    xnstat_exectime_get_last_switch((thread)->sched)

00331 /* Class-level operations for threads. */
00332 static inline int xnthread_get_denormalized_prio(xnthread_t *t, int coreprio)
00333 {
00334         return t->ops && t->ops->get_denormalized_prio
00335                 ? t->ops->get_denormalized_prio(t, coreprio) : coreprio;
00336 }
00337 
00338 static inline unsigned xnthread_get_magic(xnthread_t *t)
00339 {
00340         return t->ops ? t->ops->get_magic() : 0;
00341 }

00351                   const union xnsched_policy_param *sched_param);

00357 int *xnthread_get_errno_location(xnthread_t *thread);

00359 static inline xnticks_t xnthread_get_timeout(xnthread_t *thread, xnticks_t tsc_ns)
00360 {
00361         xnticks_t timeout;
00362         xntimer_t *timer;
00363 
00364         if (!xnthread_test_state(thread,XNDELAY))
00365                 return 0LL;
00366 
00367         if (xntimer_running_p(&thread->rtimer))
00368                 timer = &thread->rtimer;
00369         else if (xntimer_running_p(&thread->ptimer))
00370                 timer = &thread->ptimer;
00371         else
00372                 return 0LL;
00373 
00374         /*
00375          * The caller should have masked IRQs while collecting the
00376          * timeout(s), so no tick could be announced in the meantime,
00377          * and all timeouts would always use the same epoch
00378          * value. Obviously, this can't be a valid assumption for
00379          * aperiodic timers, which values are based on the hardware
00380          * TSC, and as such the current time will change regardless of
00381          * the interrupt state; for this reason, we use the "tsc_ns"
00382          * input parameter (TSC converted to nanoseconds) the caller
00383          * has passed us as the epoch value instead.
00384          */
00385 
00386         if (xntbase_periodic_p(xnthread_time_base(thread)))
00387                 return xntimer_get_timeout(timer);
00388 
00389         timeout = xntimer_get_date(timer);
00390 
00391         if (timeout <= tsc_ns)
00392                 return 1;
00393 
00394         return timeout - tsc_ns;
00395 }
00396 
00397 static inline xnticks_t xnthread_get_period(xnthread_t *thread)
00398 {
00399         xnticks_t period = 0;
00400 
00401         /*
00402          * The current thread period might be:
00403          * - the value of the timer interval for periodic threads (ns/ticks)
00404          * - or, the value of the alloted round-robin quantum (ticks)
00405          * - or zero, meaning "no periodic activity".
00406          */
00407        
00408         if (xntimer_running_p(&thread->ptimer))
00409                 period = xntimer_get_interval(&thread->ptimer);
00410         else if (xnthread_test_state(thread,XNRRB))
00411                 period = xnthread_time_slice(thread);
00412 
00413         return period;
00414 }
00415 
00416 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY
00417 static inline int xnthread_register(xnthread_t *thread, const char *name)
00418 {
00419         return xnregistry_enter(name, thread, &xnthread_handle(thread), NULL);
00420 }
00421 
00422 static inline xnthread_t *xnthread_lookup(xnhandle_t threadh)
00423 {
00424   xnthread_t *thread = (struct xnthread *)xnregistry_fetch(threadh);
00425 
00426         return (thread && xnthread_handle(thread) == threadh) ? thread : NULL;
00427 }
00428 #else /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY */
00429 static inline int xnthread_register(xnthread_t *thread, const char *name)
00430 {
00431         return 0;
00432 }
00433 
00434 static inline xnthread_t *xnthread_lookup(xnhandle_t threadh)
00435 {
00436         return NULL;
00437 }
00438 #endif /* !CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY */

00441 }
